sense.name: a spatial dimension of a three-dimensional object
sense.examples: We measured the thickness of the bookshelves to make sure they would fit in the space. The immense thickness of the walls prevented any sounds from escaping the dungeon. There is just a single thickness of plywood between the two outer boards.

sense.name: indistinct vocal articulations
sense.examples: The thickness of his voice suggested he'd been drinking heavily. After her stroke, Mary's grandmother had a certain thickness to her speech.

sense.name: The quality of denseness of a material
sense.commentary: THICKNESS[+quality][+compactness][+density] Note: refers to compactness of a substance in a given area
sense.examples: She ran her hand through the thickness of her coat's mink fur. Bob tried a treatment to increase the thickness of his hair. The thickness of flying insects at dusk made us decide to move the party indoors. THe boats waited at anchor until the thickness of the fog had lifted.

sense.name: the quality of resistance to flow, viscosity of a liquid
sense.examples: The thickness of the syrup is just right when it coats the back of a spoon. The thickness of honey prevents bacteria from growing in it. The tanks got bogged down in the thickness of the mud.

sense.name: the quality of being stupid, dull
sense.examples: Bob despairs of what he perceives as a thickness of mind in most politicians. Betty felt his thickness about people's feelings was inexcusable.
